title: How to Remove Sharpie Stains from a Wall

steps.headline: Find the spots on the wall where the Sharpie marks are.
steps.description: If this has come about as a result of children drawing on the wall, you may need to check more than just one area of the wall.

steps.headline: Choose one of the following solvents to remove the Sharpie:
steps.description: Hairspray Hand sanitizer Rubbing alcohol Nail polish remover

steps.headline: Find a clean washcloth or rag.
steps.description: Apply the chosen cleaning solvent to the cloth or rag, to dampen it.

steps.headline: Rub the washcloth on the wall where the Sharpie stains are.
steps.description: When rubbing, use a little force (scrubbing) in order to remove the Sharpie stains.

steps.headline: Keep applying the hairspray, hand sanitizer, rubbing alcohol, or nail polish remover to the washcloth as needed.
steps.description: Keep scrubbing on the wall, to ensure that all of the Sharpie residue has been removed.

steps.headline: Wipe off any residue with a clean cleaning cloth or rag.
Allow to dry.
steps.description: With luck, the stain will be completely removed.

steps.headline: Paint over the stain either if the removal methods failed to work (or only partially worked) or you don't want to fiddle with cleaning at all.
Clean the wall first.
steps.description: Wash off any attempts made at cleaning the wall, grime, etc. Paint requires a clean surface to adhere to.

steps.headline: Find the name of the paint on the wall where the Sharpie is located.
Find or purchase a can of the same color paint.
steps.description: You'll also need a paintbrush. To make sure that the paint doesn't get on anything else, use a drop cloth and tape off anywhere that the paint might touch.

steps.headline: Lightly paint over the Sharpie marks.
steps.description: You do not need much paint to do this.

steps.headline: Let the paint dry.
steps.description: Sharpie all gone. Enjoy your new wall!

tyn: Hairspray, rubbing alcohol, hand sanitizer or acetone polish remover
Rags or cloths (clean), for cleaning with
Paint in same color as the wall
